response:
Crossed findings with right lower motor neuron facial weakness, right internuclear ophthalmoplegia with gaze-evoked nystagmus, contralateral (left) spastic hemiparesis with hyperreflexia and Babinski, left-predominant hemisensory loss, and gait ataxia are best explained by a single lesion in the right dorsal pons involving facial nerve fascicles/nucleus, medial longitudinal fasciculus, and adjacent corticospinal and sensory pathways.

lesion_locations = ["right dorsal pons"]
